Product Reviews.8:
The storage of the Oculus Quest 2, like any gaming console, uses up a healthy chunk of its storage for required software: 11. 3GB, to be exact. Plus, it comes pre-installed with a few demos and First Steps tutorials, but those can be uninstalled if you wish, freeing up a few hundred megabytes. You get a little over 116GB of actual storage with the 128GB Quest 2, while the 256GB Quest 2 has a whopping 245GB left for games storage! Gamers who might want to be future-proof could still consider the 256GB version, but the $399 price makes it less affordable for most. The original Oculus Quest 256GB version didn't make much sense to spend extra money on because original Quest games used to average around 1-2GB in size. These days, the best Quest 2 games now hover around the 8-12GB range for many titles.
The Oculus Quest 2 is very cool technology. It is not as cool as the technology in Sword Art Online, but you will not be fighting for your life while being stuck in the game. The headset is a bit on the heavy side but comfortable. The straps are quickly be adjusted front-to-back and side-to-side for the best fit. You can also use a spacer to make extra room for glasses. Most size glasses should fit fine in gear, but oversized frames will not. The hand controls are easy to learn and easy to use. The feedback is excellent, and I have not had trouble with lag. The system as a whole is very responsive. The speakers and microphone are apparent. The OS is very user-friendly, and the system walks you through many tasks when first set up. The audio controls even understand my slurred English. Speakers are built into the headset’s strap supports, offering directional left and right stereo sound. They’re reasonably clear and loud enough to get across your games' drama and directional audio feedback while keeping your ears free to allow you some awareness of your physical surroundings. If you’re playing in a room with a friend, they’ll hear everything going on using the built-in speakers, but there’s also a 3. 5mm jack if you want to connect your headphones for a private session. A decent set of stereo speakers are built into the side arms of the strap and produce immersive positional audio. If you want to be isolated, you can plug a regular set of headphones or earbuds into the headphones socket on the side of the headset, but I liked being able to hear a little bit of the natural world as I played. Definitely worth the purchase!
Product Reviews.9:
Let me start by saying that this headset is really awesome for the price. There's just not any VR headsets out there in this price range, and this is a decent one by any standard. That's for sure. I 100% recommend it. My kids and I have had a blast with it. There's fun for the whole family. Even my 4 year old can sit and ride roller coasters, despite barely being able to hold the controllers.

That said, there are a few things that could be improved, and unfortunately the latest version of the Quest is double the price of this one (too much for my blood):
-Screen casting. So yesterday I had the option to screen cast to the TVs on my network. Today? Nope. Now it says to cast to my phone and mirror to the TV. Literally overnight they took away a great feature. What the heck?? I searched the internet and there are others saying the same thing. I hope they bring it back soon. It's great to share your experience with others or help your small kids through things.
-Weight/comfort. This thing is pretty heavy to have on your face for a long time. It can be difficult to get it to fit comfortably with the OOTB strap. They skimped a bit on the straps for sure. I've ordered a better strap and hope it helps with comfort.
-Battery life & charging cability. They say the battery lasts 2 hours, which I question, but even 2 hours seems like nothing on a weekend where all of the kids take turns on the headset nonstop all day. So I hooked up a 15' USB charging cord (which you have to buy seperately, mind you), but the charging is still just barely able to keep up to the power draw on a 2 amp charging block (total 10 watts of charging). So you better be sure you don't accidentally yank that USB cable out of the wall.

I'm ordering a QC3.0 charger (a 3 amp charger) in hopes that it helps (people on the internet say it can charge up to 15 watts on the Quest 2) with a 15' cable that is rated for 30 watts to ensure I don't have a bottle neck in my cable. A 50% boost in charging speed would be great. It's a shame that they didn't design it to just use a barrel plug w/ an AC adapter, which could give you way more power than a standard USB-C connection. Plus you wouldn't have to worry about making sure you have the correct (and expensive) USB cables and adapters, which would still be the case even if they used high-wattage PD power delivery. I hate being constrained by batteries, and even more so by batteries and slow chargers.
Product Reviews.10: OMG THIS WAS MY BEST PURCHASE OF 2023. I didn’t know how much I was missing not having a VR for myself and gaming. This was a life changer. From traveling the word to dungeon diving against goblins and skeletons the Meta Quest 2 can do it all. I bought to get into VR after hearing about the Meta Quest 3 and Apple Vision Pro. I love playing games but YouTube and other apps are the cherry on top. I recommend it for anyone wanting to get into VR, I think it’s a great intro

Product Data.Product Name: MARVEL’S SPIDER-MAN 2 – PS5 Launch Edition
Product Data.Product Description: Launch Edition Includes: Arachknight Suit for Peter early unlock (includes three color variants), Shadow-Spider Suit for Miles early unlock (includes three color variants), Web Grabber gadget early unlock, +3 Skill Points Spider-Men, Peter Parker and Miles Morales, return for an exciting new adventure in the critically acclaimed Marvel’s Spider-Man franchise. Swing, jump, and utilize the new Web Wings to travel across Marvel’s New York, quickly switching between Peter Parker and Miles Morales to experience different stories and epic new powers, as the iconic villain Venom threatens to destroy their lives, their city, and the ones they love. An evolution of the Spider-Man story: The incredible power of the symbiote forces Peter and Miles to face the ultimate test of strength, both inside and outside the mask, as they balance their lives, friendships, and their duty to protect those in need. Experience two playable Spider-Men: Quickly swap between both Spider-Men as you explore an expanded Marvel’s New York. Experience Peter’s new symbiote abilities and Miles’ explosive bio-electric venom powers, and discover upgradeable, high-tech equipment that enhances the combat experience for extensive gameplay depth and variety. Battle iconic Marvel Super Villains: Fight against a variety of new and iconic villains, including an original take on the monstrous Venom, the ruthless Kraven the Hunter, the volatile Lizard, and many more!

Product Reviews.1:
Spider-Man 2 for PS5 is an incredibly immersive, enjoyable gaming experience. Despite some criticism surrounding its purportedly 'woke' themes, I opted to separate my political viewpoints from my gaming experience. In doing so, not only was I able to appreciate the game, but it genuinely exceeded my expectations.

The narrative construction corresponds to some of the most seamless and fascinating Spider-Man adaptations I've encountered across various mediums, be it television series, films, graphic novels, or even other video games. The compelling story intertwines effortlessly with the gameplay, making it a truly gripping depiction of the Spider-Man universe.

The gameplay, brimming with action sequences, engaging combat mechanics, and authentic Spider-Man mobility, is yet another impressive aspect of the game. It not only offers a fun, immersive playthrough but also promises high replay value with enough content and varying difficulty levels to keep you coming back for more.

While there are minor glitches here and there, they do not detract significantly from the overall gameplay. And rest assured, in their constant efforts to improve user experience, Sony will likely be implementing patches in the future to rectify these glitches.

In terms of graphics, the game offers rich, crisp, and detailed visuals that take full advantage of the PS5's powerful hardware. The painstakingly crafted and vividly realized world of New York City, from its towering skyscrapers to its bustling streets below, is eye-catchingly beautiful.

The voice acting and score further enrich the game's cinematic quality. From the spectacularly realized characters to the dramatic orchestral music, every element adds to the atmosphere of the game.

All in all, Spider-Man 2 is a phenomenal addition to the PS5 lineup, encompassing a potent blend of gripping story, engaging gameplay, admirable graphics, and excellent audio design. It's a well-rounded gaming experience worth exploring, regardless of your politicial stance.
Product Reviews.2:
Great story, great animations, great graphics. I mean this game is a huge step up from Spider-Man and Miles Morales in terms of graphics. This is like when you played beat em ups on NES then switched to SNES and the character sprites were bigger, beefier and looked so much better. That is the best way I can describe this. The addition of new traversal techniques are welcome and really add fun to moving around NYC.

Speaking of NYC, the map has been added to making it even more huge, they added Queens and Brooklyn and a couple other areas. I'm not from NYC, so I'm not that familiar with them. Fast travel is really cool, I mean, I'm not a fast travel person, but I had to try it out once and it's silky smooth, and there is no loading!

The story is great! Really tugs on the heart strings and Peter and Miles are great playing off each other. I don't want to spoil anything about the story because I went in blind and I was completely floored by the story and where it went. Just know it's fantastic!

Overall, this is the best PS5 game this year and you should already own it. It took me about 28 hours to get the plat on Spectacular difficulty, and you only have to play it once to get the plat (but I'm sure you'll be playing it over and over). The only downside is that there isn't any NG+ stuff, like not even a NG+ mode. There isn't any reason to play this in NG+ like there was with Spider-Man and Miles Morales. Although I heard they are adding a NG+ mode by the end of the year, but I don't know why if there isn't any incentive to replay the game.
Product Reviews.3:
I am still exploring all the game has to offer me. But this is an improvement on the first game on many levels.

This time around we get to play and switch between 2 heroes: Miles Morales and Peter Parker.
Each of them has unique abilities. Miles has abilities that revolve around his venom abilities, and Peter relies on his gadgets which can change gameplay and keep things fresh.

You also have the return of side activities and pop-up crime that help you gain exp and resources to upgrade your gear and suits.

One new thing for traversal is gliding, you gain access to this right in the beginning which makes exploring the city so much more fun.

Story wise it is a classic spiderman tale. I haven't played through it all but I can see a very promising setup that is bound to be a whole rollercoaster.

Do you need to play the previous games?
I recommend that you at least play the first insomniac spiderman game. The game offers a recap but a lot of call backs and nuance will be lost if you hop right into this game. On the other hand, you can completely skip the Miles Morales game and play this one. The Miles Morales game is only about 8 hrs of story which this game gives you a good recap of. Plus maybe skipping it will offer some more "freshness" to playing Miles in this game.

Cons:
This game at its core retained a lot of what made the first game great. But it can feel repetitive. Combat as usual is not so much challenging but a mashing of buttons against enemies that soak up damage to different degrees depending on how "tough" they are. When the game tries to challenge you, it does so by throwing enemies that block you or try to overwhelm you with numbers which after a few fights can get cumbersome. The fights are definitely more enjoyable as Miles. At least for me.

There is some grind to this game, but only if you want to unlock everything and get every activity done. And I recommend at least unlocking skills because otherwise, combat will get even more stale.

Pros:
The graphics are beautiful
The swinging and traversal of the city is fun and so spot on.
Story is intriguing and the character switching is fun and freshens up the gameplay

Now, is the game worth $69.99? Sadly, not to me.

Don't get me wrong, it is a fun game and if you liked the previous games and you enjoy Spiderman/Marvel you will like this game. You have a lot of gameplay and a lot of content to find and explore but when I looked it up the campaign averages 18-20 hrs without the side activities. When you include the side stuff you are looking at 30 hrs of gameplay. Unless you pursue a completionist gameplay then you are looking at 40 hrs (estimated)

But the content is not enough to warrant the not-so-new price increase of video games. If you are really excited about the game, you can buy it at full price. But honestly, I would wait for a sale if you can. Holidays are right around the corner afterall.
Product Reviews.4:
This is easily the best Spiderman game ever made. The story is the best Insomniac has ever written, and the characters each have an arch that develop them over the course of the story. Every character is developed and by the end of the game they are different.

The traversal is 2-3x faster than the first Spiderman on PS4 and Miles Morales, momentum plays a much larger role in web swinging causing you to traverse much farther and faster when it’s built up.

The new powers for Peter bring him up to the level of Miles with powers, and the Spider legs are also a nice addition adding new special moves that can clear out enemies in droves. The new web line lets you take out multiple enemies at once in stealth and is a perfect addition to the game. There are a substantial amount of enemies thrown at you in each fight and this makes the combat even more challenging. Enemies have new attacks that can knock you out of the air, forcing you to adapt.

The boss battles are revamped and boss battles require much more attention. Bosses also have health bars now which makes them feel more traditional. The new parry mechanic forces you to block attacks that you cannot dodge, adding a layer of depth to them that will challenge you more. Some attacks can only be dodged, while others can only be parried. The boss fights are also much grander in scale while also more of them are thrown at you than in the previous 2 titles.

The side mission in SM2 are also much better than the previous 2 games (Howard the pigeon collector mission stands out at one of the best in the game and it is a side mission). Certain crime activities feel stale, such as stopping cars and fighting arsonists, but only a limited amount of these need to be done to 100% the game. More variety in this area would be nice, but this is not that important in the grand scheme of what the game offers.

Overall, this game is the first true “next generation” game all around with graphics, performance, fast travel, and super fast traversal. It is a showcase for what the PS5 Was designed for, and nothing on the market quite touches the stellar 60fps with ray tracing in an open world that loads as fast as this. This is a generation defining game that will be revered for years to come.
Product Reviews.5:
I recently dove into the web-filled world of Insomniac’s Spider-Man 2 for the PS5, and let me tell you, it’s a spectacular experience that swings above and beyond its predecessor!

From the moment you put on the Spidey suit, the upgraded graphics on the PS5 shine, delivering stunning visuals that capture the essence of New York City like never before. The cityscape is alive with vibrant details, and the fluidity of both Spider-Man’s movements adds a layer of realism that’s truly breathtaking.

One of the standout features is the enhanced combat system. Insomniac has managed to blend the smooth acrobatics of Spider-Man with a more intuitive combat interface. Combining punches, kicks, and web-based attacks feels incredibly natural, providing a satisfying combat experience that keeps you engaged throughout. It’s the closest I will ever feel to being Spider-Man!

The storyline is another highlight. Insomniac weaves a compelling narrative that delves deeper into Spider-Man’s world, introducing new characters and unexpected twists(no spoilers). The emotional depth of the characters adds a layer of authenticity that elevates the overall gaming experience.

Web-swinging has always been a defining aspect of Spider-Man games, and Insomniac nails it once again. The seamless transition between swinging, wall-running, gliding, and acrobatics makes traversing the city a joy.

I also appreciate the attention to detail in the side missions and activities. They’re not just filler content; each one contributes to the overall narrative and rewards players with valuable upgrades and insights into Spider-Man’s world.

In summary, Insomniac’s Spider-Man 2 for the PS5 is a must-play for any fan of the web-slinger. It successfully builds upon the foundation of the first game, delivering a visually stunning, emotionally resonant, and thoroughly enjoyable experience. Whether you’re swinging through the skyscrapers or facing off against iconic villains, this game truly captures the essence of being Spider-Man. Highly recommended for both fans and newcomers alike!
Product Reviews.6:
A great Spiderman game with outstanding visuals and some appreciated gameplay mechanics. The story is well written and enjoyable. Many gripes hold me back from giving this a solid 5 stars. We've seen the same moves and abilities with some fresh tweaks but over time the combat is going to feel a bit boring since it is recycled from previous games. What makes me dislike the game is the boss encounters, it's too overwhelming having to take more than 5-10 minutes to go on 3 rounds fighting the bosses. I played this in spectacular difficulty so you’re going to be sitting there for a while just to proceed through the main story. Another thing I dislike is the glitches, after installing the game. $70 is a hefty price tag when some scenes aren't rendered properly or the game just crashes because of the bugs. I've had multiple issues with the framerate frequently dipping completely taking me out of the immersion. Last but not least the story is unforgivably short took me less than 5 days to complete again $70 I would expect those hours of playing to be worth the money but to me, it falls short, yeah there are sides missions, and activities but they feel boring after a while since it’s the same thing over and over.

I would wait for a sale if you’re looking to buy the game.

4.3 out of 5 - Good 👏
Product Reviews.7:
I might be biased as a Spider-Man fan since the age of 4. Which was 1982, and this game is pure superhero power fantasy excellence. I am having so much fun swinging and flying through NYC. It’s fast, smooth and slick. The same with the combat. Insomniac has really captured what you think it would feel like to be one of the Spider-Men.

The #1 pro for this game is the story. It is the best Spider-Man story that Marvel Comics refuses to tell. Specifically, it does what the comics won’t, and it allows Peter to grow up. It’s what the fans have mostly wanted to see with the character for years now, instead of the state of arrested development that Marvel seems to have wanted to keep him in over the past 20 years. It has solid character development, and rewards you for having played the two previous games. While Peter and Miles are Spider-Man, they are their own characters, with their own backgrounds that makes them who they are. It’s what makes this game the perfect package of great gameplay, great graphics and a great story.
Product Reviews.8:
Great game. Awesome sequel.

About as long as the original Spider-Man. Playing as both Peter and Miles is so sick. There's like a million different costumes. The fast travel in this game is some sorcery.

Boss battles are the best in the series. Game gets a little tough. I'd say upgrade your health and damage abilities early. I got a buncha costumes and kinda regretted it later.😣

Story is solid, much like the first game. Kraven and, later, Venom make for standout villains. The biggest turn being Peter in the symbiote suit. Reminds me of the Otto/Peter dynamic.

Only real problems being launch day glitches. Those can solved in a patch. Also, if you don't feel like paying full price, don't. There is no shame in waiting for a price drop. 5/5
Product Reviews.9:
I was really looking forward to this game, and for the most part I got the improved gameplay I was hoping for. There are added traversal options for web swinging, and you also have web "wings" that let you glide all over both boroughs. You'll find yourself zipping all over the city much faster than in either the first Spider-Man, or Spider-Man: Miles Morales.

You can also unlock Fast Travel as before, and it is MUCH faster. No more subway cut scenes. Once you've unlocked the option for that area, pick it on the map and you're there in a few seconds, mid swing or glide.

The game looks amazing either in Fidelity or Performance mode. In both ray tracing is present, though of course done better in Fidelity mode.

You play as both Peter and Miles. Most of their supporting casts are back and I like all of those characters for the most part.

The one character I sometimes don't like is MJ. Most people didn't want to play as her again and instead of listening to that, Insomniac chose to give us more missions as her. They did try to make them more action oriented, but for me they came across as bit too unbelievable even for a superhero game. I was disappointed with them.

I also felt that the writers went out of their way to malign Peter Parker, partly to help prop up Miles, which wasn't necessary. Miles is already fine on his own, he didn't need them to tear down Peter. We also have Peter doubting himself, diminishing himself at times. Once you pick up on this it tends to stick out. It's especially bad during one of the last missions. There's some dialogue that just made me shake my head.

There are some side missions that people have been complaining about.

The one mission with Miles' girlfriend, I didn't think it was so bad. It slowed the game down a bit and probably should have been optional, but I wasn't put off by it.

There were other missions and certain imagery that annoyed a lot of people. I don't think I should get into those here, though.

I unlocked the platinum trophy in about 36 hours, and for much of that time I did not use Fast Travel, and I did some goofing off and messing around, not focusing on anything specific. If you're just looking to do the story, you're looking at maybe 12-15 hours, and that's being generous.

You don't need to play on Ultimate difficulty to get trophies or anything. You beat the game, and get the option to play on Ultimate for seemingly nothing other than the challenge.

I enjoyed this game overall, but I worry a bit about what they will do with Peter Parker in the next game. The Wolverine game will also take place in this universe, and I worry that Insomniac is veering off course and we may get a Logan that is somewhat neutered as they prop up maybe Laura(X-23), or some other character. I hope I'm wrong. I hope they do Wolverine justice and stay focused on him and his journey, and I hope it's a violent one with nothing held back.

If you haven't picked up this game yet, you may want to wait for a sale. At $70, it might not be worth it to you. You'll have fun, but you'll probably put it down a lot sooner than you're expecting.
Product Reviews.10: I really enjoyed this game, yet after 100% completing the game I never felt an urge to replay it or try something within it. The story is surprisingly well-executed for what could have been messy and quite cliché/done before. The web-swinging is leaps and bounds ahead of what it was... but, it will never quite match up to Web of Shadows for me, which had the complexity and moveset to just... you would never get bored swinging, there were always new things to try, and well, unlike turning off the swing assist in this game, it didn't feel arbitrary. I also like that it used actual pendulum physics (yes you can now do 360's swinging with a skill but it's not the same). Anyway, that aside, combat is... sigh. I feel like although some of the combat, like the L1 moves are refreshing, I find it stupid that they removed the old gadget wheel. Guys, just add the new stuff with the old stuff. Minor thing but I feel like they also nerfed the perfect dodge mechanic that would give you immediate takedowns. These might sound like minor things but they made the combat feel like annoying slogfests instead of graceful encounters where you can dispatch enemies far more quickly. I also will miss the double-takedown-per-focus-bar skill. This is a "harder" game than the titles before, especially if you play on hard mode, but again, I think a lot of it comes down to the features they removed instead of enemies or mechanics they added. Also, definitely not a big fan of the parry feature, like it's fine but it just doesn't belong in a Spider-Man title I feel like. Final words, you will probably enjoy this game, I know I sure did. I think 70 bucks for a game is overpriced but it's more up to you whether it's worth to wait for a sale or not. I will just say that my favorite game from Insomniac is still Sunset Overdrive and I don't think that'll change anytime soon with the corporate way they've gone.

Product Data.Product Name: Nintendo Switch Pro Controller
Product Data.Product Description: Take your game sessions up a notch with the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller Handheld Nintendo Switch gaming at a great price Comes with charging cable (USB C to USB A) Includes motion controls, HD rumble, built-in amiibo functionality, and more. (amiibo not included)

Product Reviews.1:
I recently purchased the Nintendo USB Switch Pro Controller, and it has completely changed my gaming experience. As someone who loves playing games on the Nintendo Switch, I've always been a fan of the Joy-Con controllers that come with the console, but I found them to be a bit too small and cramped for extended gaming sessions. That's where the Switch Pro Controller comes in.

The first thing I noticed about the controller was how comfortable it is to hold. The grip is smooth and ergonomic, and the buttons are placed in a way that makes them easy to access without feeling like you're reaching too far. The controller also has a good weight to it, making it feel substantial in your hands without being too heavy.

One of the standout features of the Switch Pro Controller is its battery life. I've used it for hours on end without needing to charge it, which is a huge improvement over the Joy-Con controllers. And when it does need to be charged, it only takes a couple of hours to get back to full power.

The controller is also incredibly responsive, with no noticeable input lag. The buttons and joysticks have a great feel to them, and I've found that it's made a big difference in my gameplay. I'm able to be more precise with my movements and actions, which has helped me improve in games where accuracy is key.

Overall, I would highly recommend the Nintendo USB Switch Pro Controller to anyone who spends a lot of time gaming on the Switch. It's a game-changer that will improve your experience and make your gaming sessions more comfortable and enjoyable.
Product Reviews.2: I am using a switch for the first time after using the ps5 and dualsense controller for around a year, the joy cons and joycon grip were quite an uncomfortable transition. this controller fixes all of that! amazing battery life, great joysticks, good weight and overall just great product
Product Reviews.3: This controller is a definite must-have for a switch owner. Especially for people who have problems with the switch Joy-Cons. It's comfortable in the hands, the response times are excellent, the analog sticks are far better quality, and everything overall is far better than what you get out of the Joy-Cons. Not a single thing I dislike about it so far.
Product Reviews.4:
I own XBOX ONE, Series X and I am familiar with XBOX controllers, and they are probably the best ones you can have. Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is AS GOOD as XBOX Series X, it's absolutely amazing.

Positives are:
- It's very light and it will fit your hand perfectly
- You would think it's low quality because it's 'very light' but it's not - it's very robust, hq build.
- Buttons are amazing, they are big and will register every possible input. It's a joy to press them

I am hoping to get some money to buy another one soon :)
Product Reviews.5: A little pricey but looks, feels, and performs great. Classic Nintendo.
Product Reviews.6: Good Nintendo brand alternative to the joy cons. I’ve dealt with joy con drift before with my regular joy cons. I haven’t experienced drift with this controller. It’s nice to hold in your hand. It has a long battery life. It is overall a good controller and would recommend it to any casual gamer.
Product Reviews.7:
*UPDATE*

After a day with the controller, I decided to call Nintendo's customer support. They ran me through the typical home diagnostics (update system/controllers, perform "input test") and then recommended I send in the controller for repair. So I sent it in.

Within a couple weeks, I was opening the box they sent back, and the receipt said "Service Performed: Product Replacement". So I guess they just gave me a newer controller? (10 years ago I sent in a Wii, and they returned a replacement Wii, so I guess that's just how they often do it.)

I loaded Puyo Puyo Tetris and tried out the controller in Tetris, and the dpad seemed to worked flawlessly. After playing some actual games, I feel like there is still some odd sensitivity that causes me to mess up a direction sometimes, but not like it did before. I will probably still play Puyo Puyo with the JoyCons.

I'll leave my rating of the product at 4 stars, since it should have worked that well in the first place, but I am now very happy with my controller.
I might want another one someday though, so hopefully this doesn't have to happen again.

*END UPDATE*

After reading about how the corded controllers tend to have 0-2 frames of input lag, and knowing that I'd rather not play most games with the joycons, I decided to get a pro controller along with my new Switch.

Now, the only game I've played is Puyo Puyo Tetris, so I haven't really tested all the functionality of the controller (I'll play Super Mario Odyssey soon though), so I'm not sure about the quality of the control sticks or how well the trigger buttons work yet. But here is what I know:

Pros
Looks really sleek ( I only see two screws; phillips head)
Charging cable plugs into top of controller
Triggers/bumpers have a bit more resistance than the Wii U gamepad bumpers, which were definitely too easy to press
Buttons are all pretty big, including dpad
Smaller buttons (Plus, Minus, Home, and screenshot) are conveniently located within thumb reach
Every part of it feels good to touch

Cons
Charging cable is USB, but only seems to work if plugged into the switch dock's USB port
Up on the dpad is too easy to press

So that last point is really upsetting; in Puyo Puyo Tetris, you need to press dpad up a lot to instantly drop tetris blocks, but there is a high chance I will drop them accidentally whenever I press left or right on the dpad. Dpad down has significantly more resistance and I will never accidentally press that. For many games this might not be an issue, but I honestly think I'll have to use joycons for Puyo Puyo Tetris. It's not horrible, but I should be able to use this controller well for any game, so there's no way I can give it five stars.

I will also note that I prefer to grip gamecube controllers with two fingers up on each hand (i.e. one each for L, R, ZL, and ZR), but this controller seems a bit less comfortable that way, probably because your middle fingers have less leverage, since the trigger buttons are smaller and not curved. However, the buttons are positioned such that having only one finger for two buttons is quite natural (more so than with joycons). Using only your index fingers is probably more ergonomic anyways.

Overall I really like this controller. I don't have a lot to compare it to, but I've played Super Smash Bros. Melee competitively for a long time (which means I've gone through a lot of gamecube controllers, and often cleaned them/fixed them myself), and this controller feels like high quality hardware. I'm just really disappointed about the dpad up button being to easy to depress. Maybe other people/pro controllers don't have this problem, but it seems like something that shouldn't have been overlooked.
Product Reviews.8: After getting duped by an eBay knockoff controller that when compared side by side looks 99.99% similar, it's a breath of fresh air to receive a controller that's 100% authentic. Everything works and it's worth full price.
Product Reviews.9: He estado usando el control por alrededor de 3 semanas y de momento estoy satisfecho, tengo 2 controles imitacion y donde mas se nota la diferencia de calidad es en el Dpad, en el control original se siente muy bien al tacto y la cruzeta reacciona muy bien cuando presiono hacia el lado izquierdo o derecho (esto funciona muy mal en controles genericos chinos). No queda mas de otra que tratarlo con cuidado porque he leido que es muy comun el joycon driff lamentablemente (muy mal por nintendo aca). En lineas generales me parece un control excelente, muy bien construido y de alta calidad, no le doy las 5 estrellas por un posible driff que pueda sufrir en un futuro.
Product Reviews.11: There are some really good third party controllers, but the pro controller is still my favorite after two years of use. Still works perfectly and the battery holds up.

Product Data.Product Name: PlayStation DualSense Edge Wireless Controller
Product Data.Product Description: Aim and move with precision by swapping in fresh stick modules* so you’re always playing with equipment that’s in great shape. Plus, three types of changeable stick caps help you stay comfortable in-game without sacrificing grip or stability. Mappable back buttons The DualSense Edge wireless controller’s two swappable sets of back buttons can be configured to any other button input, so you’ve always got game-changing actions and essential controls at your fingertips. Adjustable trigger lengths Manually set the travel distance of your left and right triggers for an optimal experience with whatever you’re playing. Fast-paced FPS? Set a shorter travel distance to shoot faster on the field. Competitive racer? Set a longer travel distance for precise throttle control on the track. Remappable buttons Remap or even deactivate specific button inputs, so you can create a completely personalized control setup that’s ideal for the game at hand. Quick-swap control profiles Once you’ve found your ideal control settings, you can save them to unique profiles and swap between them on-the-fly, so your favourite configurations are always ready when you are.

Product Reviews.1:
I recently acquired the Playstation DualSense Wireless Controller in Midnight Black to complement my gaming experience on the PS5, and it has been a fantastic addition to my gaming setup.

First and foremost, the design of this controller is sleek and visually appealing. The Midnight Black color gives it a modern and sophisticated look, and it feels great in hand. As someone who enjoys playing on my PS5 as a hobby, having a controller that not only performs well but also looks good is a big plus.

In terms of functionality, the DualSense controller offers an immersive gaming experience. The haptic feedback and adaptive triggers bring games to life in a way that I haven't experienced before. Whether I'm playing action-packed titles or exploring open-world adventures, the controller's feedback adds an extra layer of immersion that enhances my gaming sessions.

The built-in microphone is another handy feature. It allows for quick and easy communication with friends during online gaming without the need for an additional headset. This is particularly convenient when I'm playing multiplayer games or coordinating strategies with teammates.

Battery life has also been impressive. I can go several gaming sessions without needing to recharge, which is essential for uninterrupted gameplay. The USB-C charging port ensures quick and efficient charging when needed.

Overall, the Playstation DualSense Wireless Controller in Midnight Black has exceeded my expectations. It combines style, functionality, and innovative features to provide a top-notch gaming experience. Whether I'm delving into the latest titles or revisiting classics, this controller has become an integral part of my gaming setup.
Product Reviews.2:

The black PlayStation 5 DualSense controller is a refined masterpiece that perfectly complements the elegance of the console itself. With its understated yet striking design, it offers a level of sophistication that's hard to match.

Design:
The black finish exudes a sense of sophistication, giving the controller a timeless quality. The subtle textures on the grips provide a comfortable and secure hold, ensuring hours of fatigue-free gaming.

Haptic Feedback and Adaptive Triggers:
The DualSense controller's haptic feedback and adaptive triggers are nothing short of revolutionary. The nuanced vibrations and pressure-sensitive triggers add an entirely new dimension to gameplay, allowing players to feel every subtle nuance and interaction within the game world.

Battery Life and Charging:

Compatibility and Connectivity:

Precision and Responsiveness:

Overall, the black PlayStation 5 DualSense controller is a testament to Sony's commitment to excellence. Title: The Ultimate Gaming Experience: A Perfect 10/10 for the PS5 Controller!

Review:

I recently had the privilege of using the PS5 controller, and I am absolutely blown away by the incredible gaming experience it delivers. From its innovative design to its advanced features, the PS5 controller truly sets a new standard for gaming peripherals. Without a doubt, this controller deserves a resounding 10/10 rating for its exceptional qualities.

First and foremost, the ergonomic design of the PS5 controller is a game-changer. It fits comfortably in my hands, allowing for hours of gameplay without any discomfort or strain. The textured grips offer excellent control, ensuring that the controller stays firmly in my hands even during intense gaming sessions. The well-placed buttons and triggers make every command feel intuitive and responsive, enhancing the overall immersion.

One of the standout features of the PS5 controller is its haptic feedback and adaptive triggers. These technologies elevate the gaming experience to a whole new level. The haptic feedback provides a remarkable level of sensory immersion, making each action in the game world feel more realistic and engaging. Whether it's the sensation of raindrops or the rumble of a powerful explosion, the haptic feedback truly draws you into the virtual world like never before.

The adaptive triggers, on the other hand, add a layer of depth to gameplay that I never knew I needed. The resistance they provide in different situations, such as drawing a bowstring or pressing the accelerator in a racing game, adds an extra dimension of realism and strategy. This innovation not only enhances immersion but also opens up new avenues for game developers to explore creative mechanics.

Additionally, the built-in microphone and speaker are convenient features that further immerse players in their gaming experiences. Communicating with friends in multiplayer games or engaging in in-game conversations becomes effortless, eliminating the need for additional peripherals.

The battery life of the PS5 controller is impressive, allowing for extended gaming sessions without constant interruptions for charging. The USB-C charging port ensures quick and easy recharging, minimizing downtime between sessions.

In conclusion, the PS5 controller is a true masterpiece of design and technology. Its ergonomic comfort, haptic feedback, adaptive triggers, and built-in features combine to create an unparalleled gaming experience. Sony has outdone itself with this controller, pushing the boundaries of what a gaming peripheral can achieve. Without a doubt, the PS5 controller deserves a perfect 10/10 rating for its exceptional quality and contribution to the world of gaming. If you're looking to take your gaming to the next level, this controller is an absolute must-have.

Product Reviews.1: I was looking to upgrade my gaming headset and came across the Turtle Beach 600 gen 2. I was mainly looking for solid mic quality with the ability to hear yourself while talking. I get clear sound quality even 30-40' away. Overall, this headset is everything I was hoping for. I did read several reviews stating that it is fragile and breaks easily, so I have made sure to be gentle with it. Highly recommend!
Product Reviews.2:
Don't skimp on your peripherals. Get quality products from the get go or you will pay for it later. I tried saving money by getting cheap headsets. I have gone through 3 until I finally upgraded for the Turtle Beach. Seriously, the money I spent on the cheap ones would have almost fully paid for this set.

Quality sound all around. Its peak performance compared to other brands (including official xbox set). Best features:
1. Two dials to control sound. One is for game volume and the other is for party volume. The second being my favorite feature when I don't want to hear heavy breathing or slurping on the other end lol.
2. The microphone itself. Flipping up puts it on mute, reverse to talk again. Freaking awesome. Plus it can pivot towards your face if your voice isn't reaching for some reason.

Worst feature:
1. Pressing the power button a second time to get enhanced audio? Not sure if it works or not. I haven't really noticed anything. There is no risk of turning off the headset that way though, you have to press and hold for that, so that feature is great.

I would say 4.9 but we can't get that precise with our review. I'd say this is a perfect set for anything you are doing game or streaming wise, especially if you have tinnitus.

Product Reviews.5:
A fun and worthy sequel to the incredible Kingdom Battle game.

Pros: A little longer than the first at 55-60 hours to complete 100% of tasks (if it lets you.) Replaces the original's grid-based mechanics with a circular distance mechanism. The game is still based on a grid, but allows characters a bit more freedom of movement and shows distances in a circle surrounding the character to give a greater sense of realism.

Cons: Even less attached to the Mario series than the first game: Mario & Company could just as easily be replaced by more Rabbids with little loss to story. A rearrangement of the techniques used by characters in the first game makes some much more useful than others (particularly Rabbid Peach and Luigi.) No undo system this time, and once a jump or landing is performed (even if by accident) you are committed and a mistake can leave your character wide open to attack. The game also has a huge amount of bugs: both graphical, with lots of pop-in and plane shearing, and functional, with characters getting infinitely stuck alternating between two grid squares, the game randomly crashing after a targeted enemy is defeated (especially in the final battle), and one of the quests does not register as completed no matter how many times you do it. For a game that took many extra months of development and is now 3+ weeks from release without resolution, such bugs do not reflect well on Ubisoft or the latest version of the Snowdrop engine. Were it not for such obvious defects it would be worthy of a perfect score.

Some have also complained that the Rabbids are now voiced (short two or three word fragments mostly) and have dialogue, but I didn't mind. It's explained in-game as improvements in Beep-Os translation system that has occurred since the events of Kingdom Battle.
